intro: Steganthera stevensii, commonly known as the yellow steganthera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy leaves, which help in reducing water loss in its arid environment. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in dry savannas and woodlands. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its ecosystem, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
